title: No arrow function implicit return with side effects

title: Proposal. Simplify point 4.5 (Filter)
eslint v4 support
body:
## Note: I filed this issue within minutes of eslint v4.0.0 being released.

`eslint-config-airbnb` and `eslint-config-airbnb-base` **do not yet support** eslint v4.

If it is easy/possible to support both v3 and v4, we will release a non-major bump of both packages that does so, before releasing a major bump that only supports v4.

This will likely take a few weeks at a minimum.

**Please** do not file additional issues and do not file pull requests attempting to add support - please, instead, continue to use eslint v3 until such time as our configs support v4.

Peer Dep eslint combined v3 and v4 support released:
 - [x] `eslint-plugin-import` [issue](https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/issues/870) | [PR](https://github.com/benmosher/eslint-plugin-import/pull/871) | released as v2.6.0
 - [x] `eslint-plugin-react` [issue for v7.1.0 release](https://github.com/yannickcr/eslint-plugin-react/issues/1251)
 - [x] `eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y` [issue](https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/issues/266) | [PR](https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/pull/267) | [release](https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/issues/269) (v5.1.0 and v6)
 - [x] `eslint-find-rules` [issue](https://github.com/sarbbottam/eslint-find-rules/issues/279) | released as v30.1
 - [x] update and publish the base config
 - [x] update and publish the main config

title: react/jsx-no-bind: how to borrow some methods and pass them as props to child?
ESLint - make it easier to find out how to use, and fix link
body:
For those new to ESLint, it's not clear from the README how to use the `.eslintrc`. Also [the link to .eslintrc](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/linters/.eslintrc) doesn't point to anything useful (that file just reads `extends: 'airbnb'`).

By contrast, [eslint-config-google](https://github.com/google/eslint-config-google) is far clearer and [links to the actual file](https://github.com/google/eslint-config-google/blob/master/index.js).

title: In 7.4, another good expression
Add section about not spreading props
body:
Spread props should be avoided, except for exceptions like:
 - HOCs that proxy down props and hoist propTypes
 - spreading objects with known, explicit props - like if you construct an object literal (statically or via a "pick" pattern) and then promptly spread it
 - others?

Let's add a section to the React guide about this.

title: Add linting for Markdown prose
body:
I hear you like linting! Why not enforce consistent style for your Markdown prose too?

Like JavaScript linting, Markdown linting can help identify errors or constructs that not all Markdown renderers handle correctly. The linter caught a few bugs in the README.

If you disagree with any of how I've gone about this, please let me know, and I'm happy to change things.

If you disagree with the intent of this completely, then oh well, it was a fun exercise. :smile: 

## Lint Rules

My intent is to codify the existing style being used, rather than to try to change how Markdown is written in this repo.

1. I've set a catchall to enable all of the [Markdownlint Rules](https://github.com/DavidAnson/markdownlint/blob/master/doc/Rules.md) and subsequently disabled ones that don't apply. If you'd instead like an explicit list of rules that do apply (to avoid updates to markdownlint silently adding new rules), I can do that instead.
1. I disabled a rule when it appeared that one of the documents deliberately did not conform to it. (Even if this nonconformance only happened once, I disabled the rule globally rather than for that one occurrence in the document).
1. I changed document content to fix rule nonconformance when it appeared that:
   * There was a legitimate bug in the document (meaning either GitHub or another Markdown renderer would not render something correctly)
   * A rule was followed consistently, except for a few isolated cases

## Implementation

A new `lint` npm script has been added to the top-level `package.json`, and set as a `pretest` script, to match how `lint` scripts in subpackages are handled. The top-level `travis` script now also explicitly invokes `lint`.

There is now a devDependency on `markdownlint-cli` but not `markdownlint`. The [JavaScript implementation of Markdownlint](https://www.npmjs.com/package/markdownlint) is a library only, and unfortunately the CLI wrapper `markdownlint-cli` has a dependency, rather than a peerDependency, on `markdownlint`.

Thanks!

title: no-param-reassign : recommended approach?
react/jsx-wrap-multilines arrow rule breaking eslint.
body:
Dependencies:

```
    "eslint": "^3.19.0",
    "eslint-config-airbnb": "^15.0.1",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.3.0",
    "eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y": "^5.0.3",
    "eslint-plugin-react": "^7.0.1",
```

I'm getting this error in my eslint:

```
Error: [snip]/node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/react.js:
	Configuration for rule "react/jsx-wrap-multilines" is invalid:
	Value "data["0"].arrow" has additional properties.

Referenced from: airbnb
Referenced from: [snip]/.eslintrc.json

Error: [snip]/node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/react.js:
	Configuration for rule "react/jsx-wrap-multilines" is invalid:
	Value "data["0"].arrow" has additional properties.

Referenced from: airbnb
Referenced from: [snip]/.eslintrc.json
```

It appears to be caused by [this line](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb/rules/react.js#L219). If I disable it, the problem goes away.

Is anyone else experiencing this problem?

title: Adding Trailing Comma
body: If you're gonna make a styleguide, you should really lint your own guide.

title: Spread syntax
[Q] Not all airbnb rules are linted
body:
We have enabled `airbnb-base` in our elint config file, but rules like https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#comments--singleline are not linted.

All lint rules, which don't have eslint id ( like eslint: brace-style jscs: disallowNewlineBeforeBlockStatements ) are not linted, it's this correct behavior? May be I missed something.

So linted are only rules, which have eslint id.

Thank you for advices.

title: [eslint config] [eslint config base] Additional test extensions.
body: I did some searching and didn't see any discussion about this. I'd like to have `*.test.jsx` files in my project so that I can have tests with JSX that don't interfere with `react/jsx-filename-extension`.

title: Stricter rules for comments
[6.5] Add no-eval eslint rule to docs
body:
Add reference to the eslint `no-eval` rule to the README.

This rule is already set to `error` in best-practices.js in eslint-airbnb-config-base.

title: Confusing Alignment & Spacing examples
body:
From [Alignment](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/tree/master/react#alignment):
```
// good
<Foo
  superLongParam="bar"
  anotherSuperLongParam="baz"
/>
```
and from [Spacing](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/tree/master/react#spacing):
```
// bad
<Foo
 />
```
_Proposition:_

**Alignment**:
```
// bad
<Foo
  superLongParam="bar"
  anotherSuperLongParam="baz"
/>

// good
<Foo
  superLongParam="bar"
  anotherSuperLongParam="baz" />
```
**Spacing**:
No changes.

title: Unmet peer dependencies with the latest version ?
body:
Hi,
`npm info "eslint-config-airbnb@latest" peerDependencies`

returns
```
{ eslint: '^3.19.0',
'eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y': '^5.0.1',
'eslint-plugin-import': '^2.2.0',
'eslint-plugin-react': '^7.0.1' }
```

but when I install those packages, I still have 2 unmet dependencies : 

```
UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y@2.2.3 
UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-react@6.4.1 
```

Any idea ?

EDIT : I was looking for an answer and found [this](https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/issues/232) so I guess I'm in the same boat (using CRA).

title: Question: Compatibility with eslint@4
body:
It's in `beta` as of now: https://github.com/eslint/eslint/releases/tag/v4.0.0-beta.0

It should introduce changes required to support TypeScript linting with eslint: https://github.com/eslint/typescript-eslint-parser/issues/77#issuecomment-284189144

What do you think?

title: Blacklist confusing globals
body: Blacklist confusing global variables set by browser env as discussed [here](https://github.com/facebookincubator/create-react-app/pull/2130#issuecomment-302808156).
